Yup, we're around, although as others have pointed out, we haven't helped
much with Gladiator recently.

For the password issue, I wouldn't worry too much about it.  While we'd ask
that you don't start sending around a non-password-encoded version over all
the P2P networks, it certainly won't hurt to have one on your system.  And
we've pretty much relied on the goodwill of customers all these years to not
send the registered version around without a password (since it'd be easy
enough to do), and haven't had any problems.

--Tom

> straight of trying to contact them, I think we can
> apply "abandonware" principles, a la The Home of the
> Underdogs. If they do respond, however, we will
> default to their decision.
